level.heading: Burden of proof.
level.text: The plaintiff must establish that a drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related nuisance exists by a preponderance of the evidence. Once a reasonable attempt at notice is made pursuant to § 42-3103, the owner of the property shall be presumed to have knowledge of the drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related nuisance. A plaintiff is not required to make any further showing that the owner knew, or should have known, of the drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related nuisance to obtain relief under § 42-3110 or § 42-3111.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-81 substituted "drug or prostitution-related" for "drug-related".
D.C. Law 18-259 substituted "drug-, firearm-, or prostitution-related" for "drug or prostitution-related".
